## Definition 
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/carlosponcecrim/Slides/master/CRIM100_wk10/sutherland_wcc.png)

## Types of WCC

- Occupational crime
    - Refers to violations of the law in the course of practicing a legitimate occupation
- Organizational or corporate crime
    - WCC committed with the support and encouragement of a formal organization and intended, at least in part, tp advance the goals of the organization


## Features of WCC

- Offenders come from the upper classes
- Offenders have greater influence over the system (laws, regulations, law enforcement, etc.)
- Takes place in work environment
- Offences are complex and often involve breaking various types of laws and regulations
- Wider impact
- Corporate nature (legal personality) makes prosecution more complex

## Executive Disengagement 

- Top figures are protected:
    - Subordinates believe its best not to inform
    - Not legally expected to have complete control
    
## Criminogenic Market Structure

The configuration and functioning of certain economic markets pushes participants into criminal behaviour.

## Large Scale of Corporations

- Freedom at the top
- Pressure at the bottom

## Corporate Accounting Scandals

- Artificially improve company's financial standing
- Motivating factors:
    - Employee's stock options
    - Performance bonus
